sections.title: Set Goals That Actually Stick
sections.subtitle: Turn your money dreams into an actionable plan

sections.title: What You'll Do
items: Define short-, medium-, and long-term goals
Use the SMART framework to make goals achievable
Create a funding plan for each goal

sections.title: Why Goals Matter
sections.content: Without clear goals, saving and budgeting feel directionless. Goals focus your efforts, provide motivation, and help you measure progress.

sections.title: Your Goal-Setting Exercise
steps: List 3 goals: 1 short-term (<12 months), 1 medium-term (1–3 years), 1 long-term (3+ years)
For each, write a SMART version (e.g., 'Save $1,200 for emergency fund in 6 months')
Calculate monthly amount needed and add to your budget

points.title: Fund Safety First
points.description: Emergency fund and insurance protection should come before growth goals.

points.title: Automate Savings
points.description: Automatic transfers make progress consistent and reduce willpower reliance.

points.title: Review Quarterly
points.description: Adjust timelines and amounts as life changes.

sections.title: Pro Tip
sections.content: Name your savings accounts after goals (e.g., 'Honeymoon 2026'). Naming boosts motivation and clarity.
